title: Railroad Vocabulary
description: All aboard for this quiz about the colorful language of railroads and the railway industry.

questions.question: What is a 'consist' in railroad terminology?
options: A railroad worker's schedule
The track layout
A type of train ticket
The makeup or order of cars and locomotives in a train

questions.question: What does 'gauge' refer to in railroads?
options: The age of the railroad
The distance between the inner faces of the two rails
The speed of a train
A fuel measurement tool

questions.question: What is a 'switch' or 'turnout' on a railroad?
options: A type of signal light
A crew change location
A mechanism that allows a train to move from one track to another
The on/off button for a train

questions.question: What does 'deadheading' mean in railroad usage?
options: Moving a crew member or empty equipment without passengers or revenue cargo
The end of a rail line
Removing old railroad ties
A train that has broken down

questions.question: What is 'ballast' on a railroad?
options: The weight of the train
The crushed stone or gravel placed on the track bed to support the ties and rails
Water carried for steam engines
A type of locomotive engine

questions.question: What is a 'caboose'?
options: A dining car
A car at the end of a freight train, traditionally used as crew quarters and for monitoring the train
The front car of a train
The engine room

questions.question: What does 'siding' refer to in railroads?
options: The exterior of a train station
A short stretch of track beside the main line used for passing, loading, or storing cars
A type of rail fastener
The side of a railroad car

questions.question: What is a 'coupler'?
options: A coupling rod in a steam engine
A pair of parallel tracks
A mechanism that connects railroad cars together
A type of railroad ticket

questions.question: What does 'highball' mean in railroad slang?
options: A ball placed on top of a signal pole
A signal to proceed at full speed
A train traveling on elevated tracks
A drink served in the dining car

questions.question: What is a 'roundhouse'?
options: A building with a turntable used for servicing and storing locomotives
A circular train station
A curved section of track
A type of railroad bridge

questions.question: What does 'grade crossing' mean?
options: A section of track being inspected
A grading system for railroad ties
A place where a road crosses railroad tracks at the same level
A steep incline on a rail line

questions.question: What is a 'gondola' in railroad terms?
options: A small railroad-powered boat
A type of overhead crane on tracks
An open-topped freight car used for hauling bulk materials
A scenic passenger car

questions.question: What does 'right-of-way' mean for railroads?
options: The priority given to faster trains
The right to operate a train
The strip of land on which the tracks and related infrastructure are built
A railroad company's trademark

questions.question: What is a 'semaphore' in railroad signaling?
options: A telegraph machine
A type of horn
A mechanical signal with movable arms used to indicate whether a train may proceed
A type of track switch

questions.question: What does 'marshalling yard' refer to?
options: An area where freight cars are sorted and assembled into trains
A parking lot for locomotives
A yard managed by a marshal
A train station courtyard
